thread.title: Donna Hay's chocolate pound cake recipe
thread.title_full: Donna Hay's chocolate pound cake recipe - Telegraph

author: The Telegraph
title: Donna Hay's chocolate pound cake recipe
text: Looking for a gourmet getaway? Discover delicious food and fine wine in Australia » This is a recipe from Donna Hay's cookbook the new easy Ingredients Serves 12 1 cup (100g) cocoa powder, sifted ⅔ cup (180ml) boiling water 250g unsalted butter, softened 1 cup (220g) caster (superfine) sugar ⅔ cup (120g) brown sugar 2 teaspoons vanilla extract 5 eggs 1 cup (150g) plain (all-purpose) flour Chocolate glaze 100g dark chocolate 1 teaspoon vanilla extract ¼ cup (60ml) single (pouring) cream Method Preheat oven to 160°C (325°F). Place the cocoa and water in a bowl and mix until smooth. Set aside. Place the butter and both sugars in the bowl of an electric mixer and beat on high speed for 6 minutes or until light and creamy. Add the vanilla, eggs and cocoa mixture and beat until well combined. Add the flour and mix until just combined. Pour the mixture into a greased 21cm x 10cm loaf tin lined with non-stick baking paper. Bake for 1 hour 10 minutes or until cooked when tested with a skewer. Cool in the tin for 5 minutes before turning on to a wire rack. To make the chocolate glaze, place the chocolate, vanilla and cream in a small saucepan over low heat and stir until smooth. Cool slightly before spreading over the cooled cake to serve. Prize draw: win a gourmet getaway in Australia » You may also be interested in: • Salted caramel and chocolate brownie recipe » • Tarragon and lemon roasted chicken recipe »
